C1 to judge or calculate the quality, importance, amount, or value of something: It's impossible to evaluate these results without knowing more about the research methods employed. [ + question word ] We shall need to evaluate how the new material stands up to wear and tear.
More examplesFewer examplesThe effects of the drug on patients' behaviour is extremely difficult to evaluate.Her new book looks at how we can evaluate animal intelligence.In the study, ten major airlines were evaluated for on-time performance, baggage handling, fares, safety and customer service.This activity encourages students to evaluate different points of view and present their own conclusions.The magazine article evaluated ten different digital cameras and ranked them according to price and ease of use.
